page.title: 09Legends Of Two Bridges
page.content:
One of the more modern legends of the area must be that of the{Hairy Hands.} Between Postbridge and Two Bridges, there were many incidents of horse-drawn carriages running off the road. The coachmen, when questioned, stoutly maintained that a pair of disembodied Hairy Hands had seized the reins and wrenched the coach off the road: it was not only coaches, but later motor vehicles as well.
Just after World War II the occupants of a caravan had settled down for the night near where the hands had struck: the husband went to sleep while the wife remained up, writing. Suddenly she experienced a cold eerie feeling and saw two hairy hands at the window. She quickly made the sign of the cross, and the hands were never seen again.
